reviews.review_text: my 8 year old loved it!! She put it together by herself, the instructions are clear and easy.

super, super detailed. awesome and very colorful comes with many items including, computer, toilet rabbit + hutch, real working swing, pie, cupcakes, cupcake mix + tools, many many utensils, oven, shower, detailed castle bed,tv, movable stairs, vacuum. if there was a five million stars opitoin i would totally choose it.

This set was a lot of fun to put together with my daughter. The finished product looks terrific. Plenty of fun features are found in the house. My daughter thinks it's really cool. She really likes the "stained glass" accents on the glass in the bay window. My daughter is quite concerned that a bedroom does not exist for Staphanie's parents. But she still loves the set. The figures and pet are cool additions to the Lego Friends set.

I purchased this Lego house as a gift for my 8 year old daughter. She was able to put it together herself in two days. It's a nice size house with lots of accessories and detail. When my daughter isn't playing with it she keeps it on display in room. She has other sets she plays with along with this one so it makes playing more interesting.
reviews.review_header: Lego Friends Stephanie's House is great for play itself or with other Lego sets

reviews.review_text: My 4-year old loved it. We bought it for her as a christmas gift after she kept asking for it, after seeing YouTube reviews. She loved building the house together with us. But once we finished she took it apart and would build her own version of the house. No complaints. They're Legos and are really great for children to explore their imaginations. My daughter tend to use the larger pieces to build, not so much on the tiny pieces. There is A LOT of tiny pieces. They're so small that they can easily be mistaken as cookie crumbs and be vacuumed up. They are a pain in the butt because of how tiny they are. Trying to vacuum I literally have to go on my knees to make sure there aren't any pieces on the floor. We put all the pieces in a gallon sized ziploc bag and she would keep all the unused pieces in the bag. But accidents do happen and they sometimes do fall off the table. So just a heads up. These will be a mom's cleaning nightmare.
reviews.review_header: Great but a lot of tiny pieces

reviews.review_text: We love all the lego sets. The product itself was packaged VERY well. The instructions are easy to read, my 10 year old put this together herself (she would NOT let me help, pftt - whatever). She worked on it every night for about 3-4 evenings.
I had Lots of fun constructing this with my 9 year old Daughter . Instructions are easy to use, and I will be buying more of this item
reviews.review_header: I had Lots of fun constructing this with my 9 year old Daughter

reviews.review_text: I got this set for our 11-year-old granddaughter's birthday and she loves it. She built it right away.

name: LEGO Creator Robo Explorer 31062 Robot Toy

reviews.review_text: I’m really a big fan of the LEGO Creator sets. If your kiddo is bored with traditional LEGO sets this is your solution. This is by far one of the coolest LEGO projects my son has done. I wouldn’t say this is necessarily more advanced, just a different challenge. My son is 5 and knocked this out in an hr without any assistance so if you have a little one, have no fear.

I saw this kit and I HAD TO HAVE IT. I'm an adult fan of LEGO (I find building kits extremely relaxing), but I also have a mild obsession with funky robots. Both of those worlds coming together in one kit for under $20?! Shut up and take my money! This little guy looks like he could be the son of Johnny 5 from "Short Circuit". There's some great pieces here and the light brick is an awesome touch, but I doubt I'll be taking him apart, because he just looks too good in my office with all of my other robot toys.
reviews.review_header: Looks like the Son of Johnny 5

reviews.review_text: This set has it all. It's fun to build, it's got a bunch of useful parts, it's fun to play with and VERY pose-able, and it's super adorable! The alternate builds are both pretty fun, but the main robot build is where it's at. You can pick up the rocks, pose it balancing on one hand, adjust the eyes to get a bunch of expressions, and roll it all around! The tracked wheels are actually linked to a regular rubber wheel, meaning that the treads will spin if you move it over smooth OR rough surfaces! The light brick is integrated in unique ways for each of the three models, too, which can give some inspiration on all the different ways you can use one! The only real problem I have with the aesthetic and playability is the arm of the robot that has the light brick. That arm looks kind of stubby compared to the other one in some poses, and it doesn't articulate at the elbow at all. Not a huge problem though! As for parts, the main draw is obviously the light brick. This is a relatively inexpensive way to get one. The large number of pieces in this particular shade of blue is a huge bonus to me personally since it's one of my favorite part colors that LEGO makes, but it really isn't a super common color in general anyway. It's also a pretty good set to get if you want more of the tracks/treads. The Creator line of sets pretty much always come with a good variety of uncommon and common pieces for a relatively low price, and this one is no different in that respect. I bought this set for the parts, but honestly I don't want to take it apart! It's just so much fun to play with and pose, plus it looks adorable on display. But if you do just want the parts, it's got a lot to love!
reviews.review_header: An excellent set for a very reasonable price!

reviews.review_text: Grandson is eight and he put this lego together really fast. He loves it.

My son really wanted the Lego Boost robot with programming, but I was not so keen to dish out the $160 to get it for him. We ended up getting this one as a consolation gift, and he loved it! Of course, it's not programmable, but the parts still move manually. It's the coolest Lego set we've owned so far (and we have quite a few!)!!

Really cute lego robot for ages 6-12 with moving treads, It really does have a light that you can turn on and off so children love to play with it. Not the most impressive robot, but it does work and goes together quickly for target age group. My grandson takes his lego figures apart after building them so this is an inexpensive little robot that kept him entertained for months. With experence of putting lego figures together, six year old children can put this one together and have a lot of fun. The treads are cheaply built and will come off if you treat the robot roughly but they do work.
Bigger than I expected but my 7 year old can do it. Very happy with the price too

My son and I have built all 3 sets. We love the 3 in 1 sets best because we really feel motivated to take them apart and remake them - we just don't do this with the other sets. My son is almost 4 and said this is his favorite one yet (we have mythical creatures and dinosaurs which are both really cool) - I'm thinking the light and the fact that it is a robot with lots of moving parts helps. He's been playing with the built robot models as toys - they hold up well. While I'm always fascinated by the ways Lego has utilized the same pieces in different ways - my son actually noticed the creativity in using the light as eyes, a laser, and a jet boost - it got him thinking - which is priceless right? The instructions are easy enough he's able to follow them with a bit of help (at his age he had a much easier time with the dinosaur kit though.) As we both love to build - this has provided a great opportunity for us to work together, practice teamwork, and have lots of little teaching moments. :-) My only complaint (if you could call it that) is that the other sets have a "secret" 4th model if you go online - so far this just has the 3.
reviews.review_header: Fun over and over and over and over

name: LEGO Creator Mighty Dinosaurs 31058 Dinosaur Toy

reviews.review_text: This is one of the most fun 3-in-1 kits that I have found at such a great price. You have the ability to build not only the advertised 3 dinosaurs but also a fourth bonus build set of instructions are available at Lego (see photos attached to this review.) The builds that come with the kit are a T-Rex, a Triceratops and a Pterodactyl. The bonus build appears to be a Brachiosaurus. We bought two kits so we could have dinosaur battles with our grandson. He is really getting into dinosaurs at the moment, so this kit came at a perfect time. In order to construct each dinosaur, you pretty much have to take the previous one completely apart. It only takes a short time (less than an hour) to rebuild it though it may take younger kids more time. The dinosaurs are articulated very well. The legs, tails, and neck/heads all have hinge points. It makes it great fun to use in battle. We love the kit. The only thing that could make it better would be in Lego had offered it in a variety of colors.
reviews.review_header: Cool 3-in-1 Lego Dinosaur Kit with bonus build available

reviews.review_text: One of the best LEGO sets of its size. Sturdy enough to actually play with without it falling to pieces (and that's saying a lot when it's a T-Rex). Sure, a claw or foot might pop off, but nothing catastrophic. I am buying another set to keep for the next time one of my daughter's friends has a birthday party. Any kid who likes dinosaurs and LEGOs (which is all of them, right?) should love this set.
reviews.review_header: Great set. My daughter loves it (6 years old).

reviews.review_text: My son loved this set. Admittedly, because he is 4 years old, we only got about a quarter of the way through the construction before having to take a break. He then decided he would prefer to turn what we had constructed into a spaceship instead of the dinosaur, and took creative reign at that point, but I think in a year or so, he will have the patience to actually complete this as designed. In spite of not using it as designed, the kit is really cool, and he absolutely loves the claws and bones, etc and uses them with his other lego sets.
reviews.review_header: 4 Year Old Boy LOVES the bones & claws!

reviews.review_text: This didn't take long to put together, but my son loved it, despite being solely interested in Ninjago Legos usually. I believe his exact words were, "It's cool, mom." For the price, I'd say that's a win. I wish the rest of the Mighty Dinosaurs collection was as reasonably priced.

this is actually a 4n1. you can find the 4th set of directions on lego.com/creator. My son loves this. Good selection of builds. Sometimes when you buy creators there are cool build and others that aren't as cool. My son loves all 4 of these! He wants more of these sets so he can have a dino collection so he doesn't have to take a part.
reviews.review_header: good set of builds with a 4th one too!

reviews.review_text: My sons have many, many lego sets. This is definitely one of my favorites. The details are amazing (especially the teeth and claws). We have only assembled it as the t-Rex so far, but it is so cool. This is a no brainer for any 4-6 year old (girl or boy) birthday gift.
reviews.review_header: One of my favorite lego sets so far. And so well priced!

reviews.review_text: This is a fantastic Lego set. My son had me buy it for him with some of his birthday money, and he's had to share it with my 3yo. The three different dinosaurs in one set thing is seriously awesome, and I really don't mind being asked to transform the thing into a new dinosaur. (I like putting Lego together even at 38, heh) Each dinosaur has a lot of moving parts, which gets a bit frustrating since it comes apart easily, but that's also what makes it really cool. My younger son's face lights up whenever he sees the "new" dinosaur. Very clever design, and I'll definitely buy others like it.
The people at Lego are amazing, this kit is the most creative of any I've ever seen or dreamed of. The ball joints give the creations a very lifelike range of motion, my 5 yo son loves these.

name: LEGO City Police Station 60141 Building Kit with Cop Car, Jail Cell, and Helicopter, Top Toy and Play Set for Boys and Girls (894 Pieces)

reviews.review_text: Bought this for my 5 year old brother who loves legos. Age appropriate and fun to build :)

Great details, lots of fun. My boys love playing with this set. So many great things to this set. Wouldn't recommend for younger kids, the amount of steps and details are pretty extensive. However if you're like me and you like building the sets for your youngins, then this one is still a lot of fun for younger kids to play with once it's assembled.
reviews.review_header: And amazing set, hours of fun!

reviews.review_text: This product arrived today and the grandkids were thrilled! Thank you for the prompt delivery.

My 5-year-old is obsessed with legos and police. This was a dream-come-true gift for him. It took a long time to build (seeing as how he is 5) but it has been worth it. He has spent hours playing with this and incorporating the other police legos he has. Well worth the investment for our family!
Bought this for my 13 year old son who put it together himself within hours. He displays it on his dresser and it looks pretty cool. Received product in perfect condition and got it quickly.
This was a birthday present for our 5 year old great grandson. His mom says he loves, loves, loves it! You can't go wrong with Legos!

It is a super set for toddlers who are fond of police! It contains both: police department and prison. As always, everything is very realistic, super quality , good assembling instructions. Lego is amazing constructor for imagination development!
reviews.review_header: It is a super set for toddlers who are fond of police

reviews.review_text: 7 y.o and 5 y.o put it together by themselves in two days. Still playing after 2 month. All pieces and parts were there. It is overpriced to my opinion. However it looks nice and bright colors.

name: LEGO City ATV Race Team 60148 Best Toy

reviews.review_text: We have become Lego freaks as of late, the grandkids are really getting into building and creating their own projects, This set was so much fun to put together as a family, I have the kids find each piece as it's needed, and use the instruction book to help put it in the correct place. Even at ages 5 & 7 they are able to follow the directions, which are detailed, easy to follow, pictures. We started by building the ATV's first and of course the minifigs, (we lost the 5 yr old here, because the ATVs were just too much fun ). Then we built the truck and trailer. Once assembled it is a very sturdy piece, the kids drive the truck and trailer all around as well as the ATVs, and we have t lost any pieces.we have a lot of new sets and this is by far their favorite. I think we may need to purchase a second set !! Highly recommend.. fun for the whole family
reviews.review_header: A great addition to any Lego collection, great for hours of fun!!

reviews.review_text: This Lego set was a gift for my 6 year old grandson. Of the gifts we gave him for Christmas, this was the one he wanted to play with first. He and I, along with his 4 year old sister, enjoyed putting it together. All of the pieces were there and the instructions were spot on. The set does have some really small parts, but if the pieces are grouped by type it was easy for him to put together and he barely looked at the directions. Great price through Amazon. Definitely recommend for lasting play-ability as the vehicles are really sturdy once put together.
reviews.review_header: Perfect Lego Kit for Kids Age 4-7

reviews.review_text: You just can't go wrong with Legos. I'm an adult, don't have kids, but I still like building these sets. It's fun and a good distraction. I don't think you're ever too old to build with Legos. This one was fun because you get a couple of minifigs and a couple of ATVs, so you can have them race.

Great kit! Pickup truck ended up bigger than I thought it would be. My son loves it even though he was too young to build it by himself. Really impressed with the solid design and the fun factor once assembled, especially with the functionality of the moveable ramps on the truck and trailer.
reviews.review_header: My son loves it even though he was too young to build it by himself.

reviews.review_text: This is a great play set. It does hold together with moderate play from 5 and 7 year old boys. Seven year old had no trouble assembling this set. We purchased this at a great price from Amazon.
My son loves this LEGO set. The little four-wheelers are surprisingly durable, as my son likes to play with the sets that he's made. He's six and could do this on his own. I'd recommend it.
I got this for my 4 year old for his birthday and he LOVES it!!! It's such a fun set with the 4 wheelers! He plays with them all day and pulls them apart and makes other "trailers".

First of all, it's a lego set so it's gonna be great. But just a nitpicky detail (because the pictures dont capture it): you can see the rear wheels through the bed of the truck, so it's not 100% realistic.

name: LEGO City Great Vehicles Pizza Van 60150 Construction Toy

reviews.review_text: All minifigs love a good pizza! This was a fun little build for a fun centerpiece to a minifig scene. Now some of my Star Wars troopers can stop and share a slice between battles. For $20 this is a good way to spend an hour or so. The build itself is very logical and sturdy. It's quite difficult to manipulate minifigs in either the cabin or the kitchen/service area, but food trucks are very cramped in real life too so in this case it makes sense. The 2 minifigures included are pretty basic - a pizza chef and a woman who is either a customer or a delivery driver (via the scooter, which I did not build). Her hair piece is so big that she can't turn her head or sit in the driver's seat. I have absolutely no clue why this set's instructions are spread across two booklets; kind of wasteful and just another thing to deal with on the table, but not an actual problem with the set.

This was a great build! It comes with a pizza and little slices of pizza! The awnings on either side open up to serve the customers. The detail is adorable. My partner and I are 30 and 27, respectively, and although this build is recommended for 5-12 year olds, we had a blast. The LEGO City builds are very awesome and come with many unique parts. Can't recommend enough.
reviews.review_header: This was a great build! It comes with a pizza and little ...

reviews.review_text: This was a fun, inexpensive set to build. Sometimes you just don't WANT to work on a 2,500 piece set, and just need something cute for a little distraction. This was perfect. Cute concept, and my son loved the theme. No missing parts, all went together well and was durable.

So adorable. My 4 1/2 yr old grandson and I did this together and while it took us a couple of hours to complete, it is beautiful and STURDY. ( for a LEGO). The figures are very relatable and this is one of our favorite lego vehicles. The side doors lift all the way up/open to reveal a pizza oven and it's like a real food truck. You will not be disappointed, but be prepared for LOTS of Layers of building.
reviews.review_header: So adorable. My 4 1/2 yr old grandson and I ...

reviews.review_text: LEGO never disappoints! This pizza truck is very cute and a great addition to my kids' Lego city.
reviews.review_header: This pizza truck is very cute and a great addition to my kids' Lego city

reviews.review_text: Extra easy assembly, 7 year old was eyeing this for a couple of weeks. Happy boy now that he has two of these.
reviews.review_header: Extra easy assembly, 7 year old was eyeing this for ...

reviews.review_text: This is another great build by LEGO! Our four year old was occupied with building it for over an hour! There is a local pizza truck we frequent weekly sounds he was extra excited to build it! I loved the little details for the inside of the prep area of the truck!

My 4 1/2 year old grandson is in love with these sets....he sits and builds step by step by following the directions. They really look great when he's finished, and gives him a great sense of accomplishment. I've tried encouraging him to build our bulk sets any way he wants, but for now, he's mesmerized. Thanks, Lego!!!

name: LEGO Classic Creative Building Box Set 10704

reviews.review_text: This is a good set for starting Lego or adding to Lego collection. Has many different useful parts in a variety of colors. Not enough parts in 1 color to build much in same color but plenty if you mix & match colors - for example if building a roof you need to use multiple color roof parts. The box it comes in is quite big for part count (15'' tall). Over all I like this set.
reviews.review_header: Good starter set or addition to Lego collection.

reviews.review_text: So much better than sets that are more like boring models. My kids actually have to imagine there way through building new and inventive things.
reviews.review_header: So much better than sets that are more like boring models

reviews.review_text: This creative box has a whole rainbow of different colors and enough variety of pieces to keep kids and adults entertained for days. The price is also amazing--around 3 cents per piece-- considering the usual cost per piece for Legos. With a decent carrying handle on top, the box can also double as a storage container once you take the pieces out of the plastic bags. Pieces come in plastic bags, sorted by color. There is also an "ideas" booklet which gives instructions on how to build a few different simple creations.
reviews.review_header: Great mix of colors and bricks for hours of fun

reviews.review_text: I was so excited to buy this set for my three old and was not disappointed. It comes with multiple colors and tons of the tiny parts that include wheels, eyes, etc.. it also has an idea book that's been really helpful. you'll really have to watch your kids with this set if they are still little. Mostly because it's so easy to lose pieces. But I never had Legos growing up and was truly so excited about getting my little guy this set. We've already had loads of fun!

Not really impressed. Most of blocks are part of certain set (dragon, ship etc) so aside from making specific items, there' a little room for creativity. It was my fault fornot researching this further - I was hoping for a more "default" version that doesn't limit your imagination as much as this one.
reviews.review_header: Not really impressed. Most of blocks are part of ...

reviews.review_text: Great starter set. The only negative would be the amount of tiny parts included. If you have small children, prepare to set these aside or be there to help little fingers that will get frustrated. There was also a weird variation of color hues. I remember primary colors growing up, now there are pieces for.... shading I guess.
Everything you hoped for and more! It has directions for some of the builds, but half of them you have to go online for.
Excellent mix of bricks for free building!

name: LEGO Boost Creative Toolbox 17101 Building and Coding Kit (847 Pieces)

reviews.review_text: OVERALL CONCLUSION ================== LEGO boost is 80% of the learning at 50% of the cost and 20% of the hassle of LEGO’s fancier Mindstorms product. LEGO Boost compares really well to all other competing robots out there, so if you want your kid to know about coding, robotics, mechanics or technology, it’s a really easy choice. The age range is spot-on: 7 to 12 years old seems just right. TOP PROS: 1) Great value for what you get; 2) Extensive models for a lot of fun; 3) Painless setup so that kids can use the app and Bluetooth connection easily. TOP CONS: 1) Needs an iPad or Android tablet, which can triple the cost; 2) Limited accessories and other sensors/motors so far; 3) App can be very confusing at times and the “unlocking” of levels is irritating WHAT CAN LEGO BOOST DO? ====================== You can build 5 different, intricate projects right out of the box. LEGO included a huge assortment of great parts so that you can build a standing robot, a guitar, a “factory”, a cat, and a horizontal rover bot. Each model is part toy and part experiment because the app has included code that makes the characters lively and interactive while leaving room for customization. All the sounds and processing is done by your tablet, so that’s a smart way to save costs and make the “brain” brick really simple (which LEGO calls the “Move Hub”). The LEGO Boost app guides you through building and programming each robot in a set of challenges that are unlocked as you go. My 7-year-old and I could only figure out how to do Vernie the tall robot so far, which was sad because he wanted to start with the guitar or factory. This is minor bump in the road, though, because I envision this being a popular toy for a very long time. The fact that the Bluetooth setup was so painless (no pairing on iOS, it was like magic) makes this much easier to deal with than other robots like Cozmo. NOTE: If your app crashes, power off your iPad completely. This worked great for me. I’ve noticed that upon installation, some apps need a power cycle to work their best. I don’t know if this is a memory leak in the iPad or what. I’m running the app on a 3-year-old iPad Air 1 (not 2) and it works great. Anything newer should be fine, and LEGO has a device check section on their website. IS LEGO BOOST FUN AND EDUCATIONAL? ================================ For sure, this product is a ton of fun and teaches a lot about coding/logic, problem-solving, and creativity. My younger two kids, ages 4 and 7, are over-the-moon-excited about it and have been counting down the days until it arrived on August 1st. My 7-year-old already spent three hours building the first robot and he was completely enthralled. I was especially impressed by the robot’s head motion and the intricacy of the gears used in this model. The app has been fun to go through, but we’re only partially through it right now. HOW DOES IT COMPARE TO OTHER ROBOTS? ================================== As you can see from my website, LearnRichly, I’m kind of a learning toy nut. I especially like logic games and programming, so robotics coding is a pretty natural fit. In our house, we have Cozmo (from Anki), Dash (Wonder Workshop), Ozobot, and *3* LEGO Mindstorms kits (the older kids do FIRST Lego League, so they’ve acquired 2 EV3 sets and 1 NXT set). (Ouch, I just realized that I’ve spent over $1000 in toy robots in the last 5 years, yikes. We don’t eat-out or see shows more than a few time per year, so that helps save cash!) UPDATE: See more below about Cozmo in the 8/15 Update.. Which robot do we like the best? So far, LEGO Boost and Dash are the winners, with an edge towards LEGO if you have kids 8 and up and a recommendation for Dash if you have younger kids. Cozmo is small and limited, but more emotive and fun. He’s definitely a “toy” and the others are “learning toys.” Oddly, he’s also capable of real Python programming after a complicated SDK setup, so it’s an eclectic mix. Ozobots are only really useful for the most price-constrained budget; save up and buy a Boost, instead. Why are Dash and Boost the best? Because they give you real coding experience and make it fun. Dash has several apps available and is generally more mature as of right now, but I think Boost should catch up and exceed Dash overall. They both can take LEGO parts for building, but LEGO far and away exceeds Dash in versatility. It can be a factory, guitar, cat or who-knows-what-else that’s coming in the future! I do appreciate Dash as a standalone, start-from-scratch project, but LEGO will be the better choice for most households. Dash has been alone in this space for quite a while, but probably just got dethroned. UPDATE ON AUGUST 15th, 2017 ========================== OK, we've had LEGO Boost for 2 weeks now. We've built the standing robot, the guitar, and the mini-factory. We couldn't get the factory to work and must have done something wrong--we'll come back to it. My son wants to build the rover next. We also had to buy a large organizer set to keep all the pieces--what I didn't realize is how many *unique* pieces there are in this set. The Mindstorms kits have lots of pieces, but they are easier to organize since there are fewer than 100 unique ones. LEGO Boost has over 200 different types of pieces; we ended up using about 60 little divided bins in plastic craft organizers. If I had it to do over again I would buy the Akro Mills 64-drawer organizer like this one: Akro-Mils 64-drawer organizer . They charge too much for the drawer dividers, but I believe another company (stack-on?) has a 48-pack for much cheaper that *supposedly* works with the Akro Mills set, but I haven't verified. Since I wrote the above about Cozmo from Anki, I realize that he now has coding in the app! It's pretty good, too, so he's now much more competitive with LEGO Boost. I will review all of them in a future roundup at my little hobby blog LearnRichly.com, but for now I at least have an in-depth review of LEGO Boost that gives you much more detail than I could put in this Amazon review. Using my 6-criteria scoring scale, the average I came up with was a 4.4 out of 5 stars, so I wish Amazon would allow me to award LEGO Boost a 4.5 star rating instead of my 5 star rating.
reviews.review_header: This *is* the robot you've been looking for
reviews.review_author: Steve M. (Check out the Learn Richly 2018 Gift Guide!)

reviews.review_text: I'm giving it 3 stars (upgraded to 4) for the concept (and positive feedback from Lego). My kid (7) loves it and it is a great introduction to robotics and programming. The app is well presented given the vast set of capabilities. They did a good job forcing you to take a gradual approach to learning by "unlocking" capabilities as you learn them. That said, there are two issues that others have reported as well. The product is so new that there is no help available with a google search. The problems: 1. The program freezes after the first motion instruction. This is very annoying as you have to restart the app, and it has a long start-up time. Then it works for a few runs and starts freezing again. 2. The programming steps, represented as icons are not documented. Most are obvious (move forward, move back, etc). Others are completely cryptic. Usually you can figure it out just by trying it, but others still remain a mystery or their effect is unclear. Another peeve is that the sound emanates from the tablet, not the robot. They should have added a speaker. I have emailed Lego support on the two issues above. I'll update this review with their response when I get it. EDIT: Lego customer support responded within 24 hours with a thorough email that included a PDF with a "cheat sheet" for all of the programming blocks (a.k.a. "icons"). Regarding the freezing program issue: they claim to be unaware of it. After some testing here, I'm thinking it might be radio interference with nearby routers and cellphones. I moved to a different room and the issue virtually disappeared. I communicated this to Lego. I'll continue updating with any new information I get from them.
reviews.review_header: Fun and educational, but with some kinks.

reviews.review_text: How to: Run on Kindle Fire HD 8 Kids Edition I bought a brand new 7th generation - 2017 release, just to run the Lego Boost. (All-New Fire HD 8 Kids Edition Tablet, 8" HD Display, 32 GB, Kid-Proof Case) Lego Boost, How to set it up & Works great! Step 1. Register and update all Kindle Patches to latest (takes a few reboots) Step 2. Sideload Google Play Store (search how on google, no hacking required) Step 3. Download official Lego Boost App from Google Play Step 4. (Optional) Lock down the tablet with password protection, so the kids can't accidentally purchase from GP Store. Step 5. enable bluetooth to work with Lego finished!
reviews.review_header: Run on Kindle Fire HD 8 Kids Edition! - How To -

name: LEGO Creator Space Shuttle Explorer 31066 Building Kit (285 Piece)

reviews.review_text: I got this for my 5 year old for his birthday. He wants to be an aerospace engineer when he grows up, so naturally he loved it! He loved that the space station had a place for the astronaut to sleep and a robotic arm. The details on the set are awesome and we had fun putting it together. I love that you can transform it again an again.
reviews.review_header: so naturally he loved it! He loved that the space station had ...

reviews.review_text: Another great LEGO set. My husband and daughter have been working on this one together. You can build three different things with this set. They’ve currently finished the shuttle. It looks great. Was easy to build. And most importantly they had fun doing it together and my daughter has continued her curiousity about space.

Built the shuttle today with my daughter and it was a big win. The build is sturdy enough to survive a careful but energetic 2-year old and was fun to build together. The design is clever in the way many Creator sets are and sparked a lot of interesting ideas for other builds. The piece selection is much more interesting and versatile than for the licensed sets. I found this set to be a great value. Once my daughter destroys the shuttle I'm sure we'll come up with great new builds from the pieces.
reviews.review_header: Great value, fun build, useful pieces.

reviews.review_text: I'm a big fan of the shuttle program, have fond memories of watching Atlantis take off back in 01. This little guy is a ton of fun to build and rebuild, it'll be the perfect companion to my new Saturn rocket.

Amazing and sturdy but the fact it only comes with one LEGO figure is a bit sad missed opportunity for LEGO also it was a bit confusing to build I built harder ones but never had as much trouble but the results are worth it but I’m not so sure what the thing on the LEGO guys back is :/ and the satalite thing is hard to fit in it barely fits still great though! And very detailed

We loved this set-Robot not included. That was a different set. This was a bday present for my 8 year old autistic son and he LOVED it. He built most of it by himself. We made the shuttle then took it apart and made the moon rider

The package I received had been repackaged. At this point I do not know if all the parts were inside as the little guy I purchased it for has not yet put the pieces together. However, it is a Lego product, and Lego stands behind their products.
This is a great set for our 5 year old grandson. He put it together in a few hours pretty much by himself. He hasn't done the other two models as he loves the Space Shuttle.

name: LEGO Star Wars Episode VIII Kylo Ren's Tie Fighter 75179 Building Kit (630 Piece)

reviews.review_text: There are a lot of pieces to this lego set but they are all very organized. They are organized by number and you assemble it per bag number. Keep the order and you will not have any problems. The pieces are fairly sturdy after assembly so you do not have to worry about it falling apart. I was actually really surprised by the sheer size of the lego set. It is not something you can just put on the corner of your desk because the wings are long. They are about 12 inches if not more just from end to end. So if you are planning to put it on a shelf know that it will take a good amount of space. It has a shooting mechanism to shoot two darts from the bottom of the tie fighter. It also comes with 4 lego figures. Kylo, stormtrooper, pilot, and a droid. The details on the stormtrooper and pilot are great! The helmet is huge but very detailed. Overall I was very happy with this. It has great deal, easy to assemble(took about 3 hours), and very detailed in design.

Purchased as a gift for my nephew; he ended up getting 3 of this exact set because everyone in the family thought it looked the coolest, and we were right. He put it together in less than 2 days (probably would've been faster if we didn't make him go to bed), and he loves it.
reviews.review_header: The coolest ship in the new galaxy

reviews.review_text: We had lots of fun putting this one together

Bought as a gift for my husband. He loved building it. For a frequent LEGO builder it won’t take a super long time to put together but it does look pretty cool! It was also less expensive to buy from amazon than directly from LEGO.
My grandson loves lego star wars and very much enjoyed building it.
IMHO it is the best LEGO set from The Last Jedi
reviews.review_header: The Best set from the movie

reviews.review_text: Great Christmas present for my son and he loves it. There are also many other things you can make with the Lego pieces other than what is shown.
Just what my grandson wanted!

name: LEGO Ideas NASA Apollo Saturn V 21309 Building Kit

reviews.review_text: I've been eagerly anticipating this release. A realistic LEGO Saturn V rocket that stands 39 inches tall with detachable stages, lunar lander and printed microfigure astronauts. I thought I'd died and gone to LEGO heaven! LEGO could have easily charged $200 for this set but kept the price tag at $119.99 which is probably why it sold out almost immediately, almost everywhere. I got mine direct from Amazon and not a reseller because I got in very early on June 1st and it has been out of stock since but I have seen supplies coming and going at my local LEGO Store. Build took 3 hours 18 minutes (see my unboxing, speed build and review video) and was challenging - not one for the younger kids. Pay careful instructions to the manual as mistakes made early on can be painful to replicate (note the use of pliers in my speed build). The finished result is an unbelievable masterpiece of LEGO engineering and a fitting tribute to the pioneers that took one small step for man, one giant leap for mankind. Check out my video review to see every aspect of the set reviewed in detail.
reviews.review_header: The Hottest LEGO Release of 2017 Does Not Disappoint

reviews.review_text: This is such an awesome set. It's my favorite realistic space set and I thought nothing would beat the space shuttle. In my case, it's the perfect father and son build. (It's also great for father-daughter, mother-son/daughter, or just any person who likes to build Lego!) It has some creative building and a lot of great little details. It has a high piece count for the price. And it's a crazy moon rocket! What can possibly compete? I got the frustration-free packaging and was worried that it wouldn't come with the normal Lego box. That concerned me because I wanted the full experience for this set. Thankfully, the frustration free box is a box just big enough to hold the whole set including the regular box. It's shipped in this frustration-free box which is good and bad. It's good because it protects the set without the need of a huge box and padding. It's bad because while it doesn't say what set is inside, it does say "Lego" and "Toys" all over the box. It was ok, but my children really wondered what was in the box which reduced the surprise. But I don't care how it came--the set is mine! It's 100% worth the hype. I strongly suggest this model. Lego has said they will keep making more through 2018, so you should be able to buy it without paying scalper prices. But I suggest you keep watching Amazon and other retailers and buy one for yourself!
reviews.review_header: If you're wondering what the frustration free packaging is...

reviews.review_text: First Lego kit I've done since I was a kid. This set was fun to put together with my daughter and is a great, accurate model as well.

This LEGO Apollo Saturn V is the biggest and imo the best Ideas set to date. Terrific detail and the completed rocket is over 3 feet tall! Can be displayed upright or horizontally on stands. Fun to build and beautiful to display! But... the retail price of this item is $119.99. It is a new release and very popular, sold out on Amazon and the LEGO site as soon as it was available. It should be in stock at the regular price again once they catch up to demand, so don't shell out extra money to these third party "marketplace" sellers unless you have money to burn and don't care about wasting it. And even then it's good idea to pass and not reward these sellers... they are the reason the set is out of stock, they buy them all up so they can turn around and gouge you! Cheers!
reviews.review_header: Awesome set but beware the price!

reviews.review_text: Received the kit, prompted some drooling (as required), and began building! Only took a couple hours, but I savored every second! Now stands proud next to my Revell 1:144 Saturn V and LEGO Discovery!

Truly a fantastic kit. One of the best Legos ever made. Assembly took me about 7 hours (!), which for the price is quite a good return on price. The rocket stages hide an enormous amount of detail inside their tube bodies. This kit is far more than just the outside of a rocket, but only those who participate in building it will discover the joy of the little connectors, thrusters, and doodads inside. It is incredibly tall. Have the conversation with your family about where to store it before purchase, to avoid heart ache. It's also incredibly sturdy. It takes quite a lot of force to separate the sections, but this also means you can trust it'll hold itself together very well.
reviews.review_header: Truly a fantastic kit. One of the best Legos ever made

reviews.review_text: Just finished building this last night in a 5 hour cream soda and twizzler building binge. It's LEGO. Good quality, the design makes sense and it was a lot of fun. It is to scale, so if you're expecting to play with the mini-figs, prepare to be disappointed. They are about a 1/4 inch high. The finished set is very tall (or long depending on how you choose to display), unless you choose to display as separate booster units. Instructions were easy to understand, and the booklet is the size of a magazine and contains some really great supplementary material about the Apollo mission, pictures, and information about the process of design and build of both the real thing and the lego version. Worth the money. As it has already sold out from LEGO once, buy now to ensure you don't lose access to such a unique set.... these types of sets always go up in value.

name: LEGO Star Wars VIII BB-8 75187 Building Kit (1106 Piece)

reviews.review_text: This is a great lego set with nice internal gears for movement that any Star Wars fan will love. It took my 10 year old son about 8 hours to assemble it and he only needed my help for 2 pages and that was minor stuff. It's a collector's item set so it includes a nice display stand and a minifig of BB8. Please view the video (that he made himself) showing the features of this Lego set and will show you the scale of the set.
reviews.review_header: Very nice Lego set for the Star Wars fan,

reviews.review_text: I take care of my elderly father and I asked his pain management doctor if she could think of anything for him to keep his hands and mind busy, she suggested Lego's and I thought that's a wicked cool idea because I have tried everything I could think of, small wood work things, word find books, coloring books, puzzles and now Lego's. So to encourage him to work on his very simple Lego set I bought myself this BB-8 set. I was completely ignorant as to how much Lego’s had advanced. When I opened the BB-8 box I was stunned and in shock. I am 47 and I have not 'played' with Lego's in a very, very long time so I got him a very simple set and I bought this 'hell monster' that I love & am still working on, so I give it 5 Stars because it is awesome and it is not Lego’s of old, when I opened it “It’s a trap!” were the first words that popped into my head! If you are an older person do not buy Lego's blindly. REALLY read the description and prepare yourself for the shock! LOL. It truly is an amazing project and it is looking beautiful so far. If you enjoy a challenge I highly recommend. BTW my dad hasn't even touched his little truck Lego. SMH
reviews.review_header: she suggested Lego's and I thought that's a wicked cool idea because I have tried everything I could think ...

reviews.review_text: AMAZING Lego set. Our 10 yr old loved this. It took him several days over Christmas Break to put together. There were several times he got frustrated and needed to take a break....life lesson. Mind blown the things you can accomplish with Legos...mechanical components too!

I am a huge LEGO fan, but because LEGO can be pricey, I generally wait for a sale, this set is no exception, cool looking but pricey, it took me about a couple of hours to build this, that included taking care of my kids, I did have one area that Just didn’t want to fit, but all in all a great kit.

Got it for my 8 year old son who loves Legos. He was super exited to get the set. My kid has autism and Legos seems to be the only toy that keeps his attention. This set was a bit more complicated then your usual Legos, but my son was able to put it all together in two days. He loves that you can twist and turn the knobs and the figure moves it’s head and opens the front “hatch”.
reviews.review_header: He was super exited to get the set

reviews.review_text: The way the head wiggles can be very similar to the movie BB8, it's very unique and very cool. This feature of the kit was pretty surprising, put it over the top for me in an otherwise relatively mundane build. The 'torch door' opens when extending the torch but does not close when the torch is retracted, which seems kinda half-baked to me. The wiggly head more than compensates to me, a pretty great kit overall.
reviews.review_header: You can make BB8's head bobble, just like in the movie!

reviews.review_text: Fabulous interactive kit from Lego that transforms into the beloved BB8 robot character from the latest films in the Star War series. Although the age range is given as starting at 10, it is still do-able for younger kids (with parental help).

A lot of fun to put together. The bobbing action of BB-8's head is really cool and cleverly done with the mechanism. He also offers his cutting torch with another mechanism. It comes with a stand that holds him and also a mini-figure BB-8.

name: LEGO Ninjago Movie Water Strider 70611 Building Kit (494 Piece)

reviews.review_text: I’m writing this review from the point of view of an adult fan of LEGO. The model itself is great—fun to put together, and looks fantastic. But the real reason I’m even bothering to write this review is that this is a fantastic deal if you are looking to kit-bash (use the pieces for other projects). There is a large variety of interesting pieces here, including four minifigures and some weapons, things you won’t ever get in the generic tubs of bricks that LEGO also sells. And here’s the kicker—with the current amazon discount (20% off MSRP), this set works out to be under the magical bar of $0.05 per piece. It’s the only set for sale directly from amazon (as opposed to third party sellers) that has that distinction, period, including the generic tubs of LEGO bricks specifically designed for creative play. The deal is so good, with such great pieces, that I bought three copies of this set: one to build and display, and the other two to cannibalize for parts.
reviews.review_header: Currently the lowest cost per piece of any themed set

reviews.review_text: Nice set. Good figure selection. Build was repetitive, building the legs 4 times. But set looks great assembled. Legs are locked in place at the center section, so the legs aren't as poseable as they could have been. And the cockpit screen was not hinged, which I personally hate in models. Sides of the cockpit aren't held in place by enough studs, so they come lose too easy when the screen is not on the model. But otherwise, a very nice set.

My 6 year old absolutely loves legos and LEGO ninjago has been a favorite lately. He’s able to put these together himself with very little help. This particular set comes with 7 bags including some LEGO men. They are really cool and will keep you busy for hours! Would definitely recommend these to any LEGO lover!

Got this for my 7 year old who for the most part did a fair job building on his own but the lego set isn’t the clearest on instructions when it came to the legs. With some help, he was able to get through it. He was very happy with it.

6 yr old grandson went crazy over this. Be advised that there are over 400 parts and many are very small. It took a total of 4 hours to put it together but that may have been related to a 6 yr old in the control lead. It shoots little blue clear "missiles" that can get lost very easily if not aimed in a direction that makes them easy to find. Avoid carpet. Great fun and well built when finished. Highly recommend.
reviews.review_header: Give yourself and co-builders plenty of time.

reviews.review_text: A bit complicated for age range, but price is fantastic at $24. The Lego engineers / designers went nuts with this one, great features!

I've got a soft spot for 'mech kits, even if I don't much care for the Ninjago theme. It's an okay build -- the vehicle core is the interesting part, and the four legs are all identical, so there's a bit of repetition. My kids love this one and the legs are sturdy enough where they're not pulling them off every time they try to change the pose. Definitely worth the money.
reviews.review_header: Somewhat repetitive build, but a good set.

reviews.review_text: Was looking for a LEGO set for a gift, and this one was simply the biggest bang for the buck. It has a lot of pieces, and makes a pretty impressive robot thing that any kid would love. It is interesting that it is only about half the price, on average around the web, as any other LEGO sets of comparable size. Can't really figure out how they price the things, but this was a good deal!
reviews.review_header: Good LEGO set for the price!

name: LEGO Boost Creative Toolbox 17101 Building and Coding Kit (847 Pieces)

reviews.review_text: OVERALL CONCLUSION ================== LEGO boost is 80% of the learning at 50% of the cost and 20% of the hassle of LEGO’s fancier Mindstorms product. LEGO Boost compares really well to all other competing robots out there, so if you want your kid to know about coding, robotics, mechanics or technology, it’s a really easy choice. The age range is spot-on: 7 to 12 years old seems just right. TOP PROS: 1) Great value for what you get; 2) Extensive models for a lot of fun; 3) Painless setup so that kids can use the app and Bluetooth connection easily. TOP CONS: 1) Needs an iPad or Android tablet, which can triple the cost; 2) Limited accessories and other sensors/motors so far; 3) App can be very confusing at times and the “unlocking” of levels is irritating WHAT CAN LEGO BOOST DO? ====================== You can build 5 different, intricate projects right out of the box. LEGO included a huge assortment of great parts so that you can build a standing robot, a guitar, a “factory”, a cat, and a horizontal rover bot. Each model is part toy and part experiment because the app has included code that makes the characters lively and interactive while leaving room for customization. All the sounds and processing is done by your tablet, so that’s a smart way to save costs and make the “brain” brick really simple (which LEGO calls the “Move Hub”). The LEGO Boost app guides you through building and programming each robot in a set of challenges that are unlocked as you go. My 7-year-old and I could only figure out how to do Vernie the tall robot so far, which was sad because he wanted to start with the guitar or factory. This is minor bump in the road, though, because I envision this being a popular toy for a very long time. The fact that the Bluetooth setup was so painless (no pairing on iOS, it was like magic) makes this much easier to deal with than other robots like Cozmo. NOTE: If your app crashes, power off your iPad completely. This worked great for me. I’ve noticed that upon installation, some apps need a power cycle to work their best. I don’t know if this is a memory leak in the iPad or what. I’m running the app on a 3-year-old iPad Air 1 (not 2) and it works great. Anything newer should be fine, and LEGO has a device check section on their website. IS LEGO BOOST FUN AND EDUCATIONAL? ================================ For sure, this product is a ton of fun and teaches a lot about coding/logic, problem-solving, and creativity. My younger two kids, ages 4 and 7, are over-the-moon-excited about it and have been counting down the days until it arrived on August 1st. My 7-year-old already spent three hours building the first robot and he was completely enthralled. I was especially impressed by the robot’s head motion and the intricacy of the gears used in this model. The app has been fun to go through, but we’re only partially through it right now. HOW DOES IT COMPARE TO OTHER ROBOTS? ================================== As you can see from my website, LearnRichly, I’m kind of a learning toy nut. I especially like logic games and programming, so robotics coding is a pretty natural fit. In our house, we have Cozmo (from Anki), Dash (Wonder Workshop), Ozobot, and *3* LEGO Mindstorms kits (the older kids do FIRST Lego League, so they’ve acquired 2 EV3 sets and 1 NXT set). (Ouch, I just realized that I’ve spent over $1000 in toy robots in the last 5 years, yikes. We don’t eat-out or see shows more than a few time per year, so that helps save cash!) UPDATE: See more below about Cozmo in the 8/15 Update.. Which robot do we like the best? So far, LEGO Boost and Dash are the winners, with an edge towards LEGO if you have kids 8 and up and a recommendation for Dash if you have younger kids. Cozmo is small and limited, but more emotive and fun. He’s definitely a “toy” and the others are “learning toys.” Oddly, he’s also capable of real Python programming after a complicated SDK setup, so it’s an eclectic mix. Ozobots are only really useful for the most price-constrained budget; save up and buy a Boost, instead. Why are Dash and Boost the best? Because they give you real coding experience and make it fun. Dash has several apps available and is generally more mature as of right now, but I think Boost should catch up and exceed Dash overall. They both can take LEGO parts for building, but LEGO far and away exceeds Dash in versatility. It can be a factory, guitar, cat or who-knows-what-else that’s coming in the future! I do appreciate Dash as a standalone, start-from-scratch project, but LEGO will be the better choice for most households. Dash has been alone in this space for quite a while, but probably just got dethroned. UPDATE ON AUGUST 15th, 2017 ========================== OK, we've had LEGO Boost for 2 weeks now. We've built the standing robot, the guitar, and the mini-factory. We couldn't get the factory to work and must have done something wrong--we'll come back to it. My son wants to build the rover next. We also had to buy a large organizer set to keep all the pieces--what I didn't realize is how many *unique* pieces there are in this set. The Mindstorms kits have lots of pieces, but they are easier to organize since there are fewer than 100 unique ones. LEGO Boost has over 200 different types of pieces; we ended up using about 60 little divided bins in plastic craft organizers. If I had it to do over again I would buy the Akro Mills 64-drawer organizer like this one: Akro-Mils 64-drawer organizer . They charge too much for the drawer dividers, but I believe another company (stack-on?) has a 48-pack for much cheaper that *supposedly* works with the Akro Mills set, but I haven't verified. Since I wrote the above about Cozmo from Anki, I realize that he now has coding in the app! It's pretty good, too, so he's now much more competitive with LEGO Boost. I will review all of them in a future roundup at my little hobby blog LearnRichly.com, but for now I at least have an in-depth review of LEGO Boost that gives you much more detail than I could put in this Amazon review. Using my 6-criteria scoring scale, the average I came up with was a 4.4 out of 5 stars, so I wish Amazon would allow me to award LEGO Boost a 4.5 star rating instead of my 5 star rating.
reviews.review_header: This *is* the robot you've been looking for
reviews.review_author: Steve M. (Check out the Learn Richly 2018 Gift Guide!)

reviews.review_text: I'm giving it 3 stars (upgraded to 4) for the concept (and positive feedback from Lego). My kid (7) loves it and it is a great introduction to robotics and programming. The app is well presented given the vast set of capabilities. They did a good job forcing you to take a gradual approach to learning by "unlocking" capabilities as you learn them. That said, there are two issues that others have reported as well. The product is so new that there is no help available with a google search. The problems: 1. The program freezes after the first motion instruction. This is very annoying as you have to restart the app, and it has a long start-up time. Then it works for a few runs and starts freezing again. 2. The programming steps, represented as icons are not documented. Most are obvious (move forward, move back, etc). Others are completely cryptic. Usually you can figure it out just by trying it, but others still remain a mystery or their effect is unclear. Another peeve is that the sound emanates from the tablet, not the robot. They should have added a speaker. I have emailed Lego support on the two issues above. I'll update this review with their response when I get it. EDIT: Lego customer support responded within 24 hours with a thorough email that included a PDF with a "cheat sheet" for all of the programming blocks (a.k.a. "icons"). Regarding the freezing program issue: they claim to be unaware of it. After some testing here, I'm thinking it might be radio interference with nearby routers and cellphones. I moved to a different room and the issue virtually disappeared. I communicated this to Lego. I'll continue updating with any new information I get from them.
reviews.review_header: Fun and educational, but with some kinks.

reviews.review_text: How to: Run on Kindle Fire HD 8 Kids Edition I bought a brand new 7th generation - 2017 release, just to run the Lego Boost. (All-New Fire HD 8 Kids Edition Tablet, 8" HD Display, 32 GB, Kid-Proof Case) Lego Boost, How to set it up & Works great! Step 1. Register and update all Kindle Patches to latest (takes a few reboots) Step 2. Sideload Google Play Store (search how on google, no hacking required) Step 3. Download official Lego Boost App from Google Play Step 4. (Optional) Lock down the tablet with password protection, so the kids can't accidentally purchase from GP Store. Step 5. enable bluetooth to work with Lego finished!

Classic Lego quality. We always purchase Legos for rainy days on the boat, so of course it made sense to buy a sea plane and rescue set. They are lego bricks, high quality, came shipped great, again not much to say since it's Lego Brand.
Shipped to my grand-nephew going thru extensive cancer treatments. He loved it. Good in hospital activities. Challenging and rewarding

reviews.review_text: This is a Christmas present for my nephew, but it is absolutely adorable! I love the little characters and the fish/crab that come with it! I am so excited for him to open it he loves to go camping every year! I was super excited to find this!

Completely surprised how well built this Lego set is. It's a must have for the Lego fan in your household. I Really like building it and my son still has it built and plays with it often. So far I think it's one of his favorites. Another must have Lego set.

reviews.review_text: Age says 7 to 12, but my six year old grandson did all three images beautifully. It was difficult, and he had a few frustrating moments, but he stuck with it and did it all by himself. I only wish there were more low price legos out there that I could buy.

My son owns most of the 3 in 1 lego sets available and this one is his second favorite (the dinosaur set was his favorite, but not by much). He was 4 when he got it and you enjoyed not only building it, but also playing with it as an action figure. The claw pieces are a little hard to be put together with his little hands but otherwise, he was able to build most of it all by himself.

reviews.review_text: My son really enjoyed it! He loved being able to take it apart and create a new toy with slightly altered instructions. I will be buying more of these 3 in 1 sets for sure!

reviews.review_text: My 5 year old built all of the three creatures on his own, but especially he liked the dragon and the fact it can "pour" fire! And after that it's time for firefighters or paw patrol to take care of it :) He had mighty dinosaurs 3 in 1 creative set before and enjoyed it a lot, built and rebuilt almost every day for a long time, and hopefully this set will have the same fate. Actually he enjoyed this set more than other sets, which allow to build simultaneously more but smaller things.
My son enjoyed putting this together, and it looks cool assembled. Enough of a challenge for a 10yo that it kept him occupied for awhile but not so difficult he couldn’t do it himself.

Shame on you Lego! One month after some parts start to brake on half already!! Especially small single pieces((they are not last long enough. Every Lego set in my son’s collection have 5-10 broken pieces(((

A great set of legos. My son loves to be able to make all 3 creatures.

name: LEGO Star Wars Ultimate Millennium Falcon 75192 Building Kit (7541 Pieces)

reviews.review_text: You already know if a $800 box of plastic bricks that will resemble the Millennium Falcon when finished is something up your alley. If you are that sort of person, you won't be disappointed in it. Thing is massive. The instructions actually have images to show you how to properly lift it and move it around. I clocked roughly 21 hrs total build time. I'm not sure if that's fast or slow. Make sure you not only have somewhere spacious to build it but also somewhere in mind to put it before starting. One look at the manual (see pic) when you take it out of the box and you'll get an idea of what you're in for.

I won this hunk of junk in a card game. Fastest ship in the galaxy if you ask me. A little rough around the edges but hey it’s got a working Dejarik board so that’s sweet. Has panels for hiding stuff from Imperial inspections and the seats in the cockpit recline a good amount. Easily meets the advertised 12 parsec jump time. Downsides: she’s real ugly. If your trying to get a date with like a princess or something, she’s probably not going to be too impressed. And there’s this distinctive wet Wookie smell eminating from it. Not sure if it’s something a couple dozen air fresheners can take care of or not.

A word of warning, the box this thing ships in is massive, it barely fit in my trunk. I opened up the shipping box to find another box, and inside that box was yet another box, and inside that box was four more boxes. Each of the four boxes contained like 15 bags of pieces, the boxes were not packaged by stage, instead i had to sort through all four. I started around 330 on a friday. Im still not done, but coming up on about 18 hours. If you are like me and grew up with legos and love star wars, but only got the sets that your parents could afford to get you but always coveted the big expensive ones, then this is definitely up your alley. Time consuming, fun to build, and incredibly detailed. I had been waiting for this thing to be available for about 8 months, and as soon as i saw it was in stock, i jumped on it. THIS is a true collectors item for both Lego and Star Wars fans. The only dilemma i have right now is where i am going to put it. If you are a parent, and thinking about buying this for your kids, think twice because this is NOT a toy. I have two kids but bought this for myself. It would definitely be a great family build project though. This build has so far been tedious, but an absolute blast and i cant wait for the finished product!
reviews.review_header: You better be willing to sacrifice a piece of furniture for this monster

reviews.review_text: I don't know how you can NOT give this five stars! If you can get your hands on this set, get it! It is the largest production set ever! It is HUGE! The box itself is more like an end table than anything else. This will provide many hours of fun! This is not for beginners or young children.

I was always regretting not purchasing the first Ultimate Lego Millennium Falcon (>5000 pieces and $500) but I was thrilled when I heard Lego creating an upgraded version of it and I promised myself that I wouldn't miss this one. This kit is huge. It took my 3 boys and me over 18 days to complete it on a part-time basis. We took out time building it because we enjoy the entire build process. It is pretty cool the way it's designed. It has a Techniques internal frame and the armor plates rest on top of the frame. I wish they designed the armor plates to attach to the frame to make it a stress bearing piece and adding to the overall rigidity of the model but alas they did not. When you finally place all the armor on top of the frame it will cause the frame to flex hence you cannot just pick up the model but you will have to carry it a certain way if you want to move it. Of course I'm just nit-picking, make no mistake this is an awesome model and an engineering miracle. I love it and it's totally worth it.
reviews.review_header: Take you time building it and make sure you place the pieces correctly...it's hard retracing your steps...there are over 1300.

reviews.review_text: It was much bigger than I thought it was despite knowing how many pieces there were. I ended up working on it for about an hour each day after work and it's been a ton of fun. There are so many small details that just haven't existed on this level before on Legos and while I had been a bit hesitant to spend the money on this at first, I can say that it was more than worth it. There is a sense of pride and accomplishment to seeing it slowly take shape and when it's finally done, it's almost sad because the work is over. Can't wait for the next Ultimate Star Wars Lego set. Gonna be bigger and better!

Great set. Really impressive amount of detail and presentation. You can really tell artists created it and that there was true passion behind the project. I bought it to take a break from technology, computer and phone screens all day. It's a great emotional relief. It makes me focus on a task instead of stressing about day-to-day troubles at work or home.

For anticipation, fun, family time and shear WOW factor, this product gets a 5 of 5 ! ! ! Since we all love it, why a 4 of 5 then? The interior/floor plan of this is not complete or consistent with the movie layout. Getting into the few usable spaces is also not so user-friendly. The design is not really solid, so it can't easily be picked up – pretty much just for looking. That said, we still love it!

Once complete it is much larger than I expected and once you get the extra set which I found at target for $15, the ship is simply brilliant and I am not that big of GOTG fan.
