My son was rewarded with the LEGO set after earning it. He is heartbroken that after a few hundred pieces of hard work and effort-we are missing all of the stickers.
Lots of fun. Lots of pieces. Took a couple of hours but turned out to epic looking when It was complete.

name: LEGO Architecture Statue of Liberty 21042 Building Kit (1685 Piece)

reviews.review_text: This is an absolutely beautiful architecture set. Some other builders have stated that they don’t like that there isn’t more detail in the face; I agree that it could look better to have some, but I don’t feel it detracts from the simple beauty of this set. I really enjoyed this one, as I build the architecture series of places that I (and/or my family) have seen. This one is different from the others in that it really gives height to the set, which allows for the folds of fabric in the statue to be seen and explored. Just a lot of fun to build, and I think this one will definitely get many comments. Kudos, LEGO !
reviews.review_header: Beautiful set in a really fun series.

reviews.review_text: I always thought that Lego bricks were for kids, but then I saw this Statue of Liberty kit and had to have it (I'm somewhat of a huge Statue of LIberty fan). I enjoyed making this kit -- the design is well thought-out, and the bricks mesh with eachother with a very satisfactory, almost sensual precision. I now understand what all the fuss is with Lego blocks. This won't be my last kit.
One of the best in the series. My only criticism is the lack of any detail in the face but the rest of it is fantastic. It is also much larger than expected and dwarfs most of the other sets
reviews.review_header: One of the best in the series

reviews.review_text: Every home needs a little Lady Liberty....I managed to build this in a few days as I got caught up in the progress and watching it get closer to it's final construction. It's an impressive piece, and stands quite tall, so it will become a focal point of any room. I enjoyed the clear construction instructions, and only needs to pry apart errant pieces on a very rare occasion. It's a wonderful piece by LEGO, and I highly recommend it for Lego Enthusiasts.
reviews.review_header: I enjoyed the clear construction instructions

reviews.review_text: This is a good and surprisingly intricate build of the statue of liberty. That said, for the price I think there are better kits like the Saturn V, which is larger and much more impressive, and sturdier too. On the other hand, this isn't as tall and won't fall over easily, so it probably would be a better desk model.

I had to order a couple of packages of small pieces when those came up short. Still, I would do it all again in a minute. You learn a lot doing Lady Liberty. Did you know about the broken chains at the Lady's feet? They are the last pieces you put on the model. They caused me to decide to read and learn more about her history.
reviews.review_header: Beautiful model with some pieces missing

reviews.review_text: Lego shorted me three pieces. You can contact Lego and they will ship you missing pieces. I managed to find some in my extra pieces. One was not the part I needed but no one will notice but me.

Absolutely perfect! I love it! It was a blast to build. Somewhere I screwed up and had to take the statue apart and rebuild (due to a missing part). I still couldn't find it, so I switched one 'unseen inner' for another, to compensate.
The APR starts at 16.99% and goes as high as 29.99%. This might be good for a small business starting out, but the terms are too high for me.
Approved but what a small credit limit considering I get 5K on a average, I Just got 500.00? A little disappointing If i have to pay an annual fee.
reviews.review_header: Approved but with a small credit limit 500.00 - My average credit limit is 6k. Disappointed

reviews.review_text: Amex slammed my account with the Pay over time program shut it down and sued me. Wtf? Watch out Amex does not have your business in mind.

I have spent 38 years trying to get AMEX credit and be it $500 or $5000, I am happy to be approved. I already had the Chase Visa with $9500 credit but the APR was too high....Its been paid off and now Ill switch my Amazon Credit decisions that aren't Debit to AMEX and build a great history with them.... Plus the card is pretty spiffy or so I think!
reviews.review_header: So the Interest is Higher, This is a card for middle of the road credit.

reviews.review_text: PR not available on the states list. Please fix this.
reviews.review_header: PR not available on the states list

reviews.review_text: less than 3 minutes... Fantastic way to apply from mobile device. Thank you amazon !!!

I love this card as a backup card. I am very pleased with the customer service department. I got my card fast and it was confirmed fast. As with any credit card, just watch you spending habits. Amazon is always taking things to the next level!
reviews.review_header: Another Great Card For My Cache

reviews.review_text: Pressed the submit button and nothing happened? Don't know if went through or not! Not going to fill it out all again!

name: LEGO Friends Heartlake City Resort 41347 Top Hotel Building Blocks Kit for Kids, Popular and Fun Toy Set for Girls (1017 Piece)

reviews.review_text: These were gifts for my great-grandchildren who live in Oregon. I ordered them from this coast and they arrived on the west coast and the two children were thrilled with the gifts they wanted.
They love their legos
My daughter loved building this one

Got this for our 9 year old daughter, whose enjoyment of Lego sets varies widely depending upon their themes and designs, and she absolutely loves it. I think it is because of the very whimsical, colorful, and fun design. Builders get to construct a resort hotel with lots of amenities: front desk, juice bar, rooftop party station with turntable, rooms & furnishings, etc. Then there's the water park side with two slides, big bucket, lifeguard station, jet-ski, parasailing, and windsurfing. And connecting the hotel & water park is the very nifty working monorail. With four friends figures, tons of bright colorful pieces (over a thousand), and plenty of playable elements, this is a set that provides plenty of building fun and a lot of lasting play value. We've had no small number of Lego sets over the years from many different Lego themes (Classic, City, Batgirl, and even one other Friends set) , but my daughter has liked this one the best. A big hit!

Lego Friends: Heartlake City Resort contains 1,017 pieces. There are 7 numbered bags and 2 additional bags for the slides, large plates, and the monorail tracks. There is 1 sticker sheet with over 20 stickers. This set is aimed towards girls 7-12. Instead of normal Lego minifigs, there are four mini-doll figures. Once finished, the resort has plenty of play details, with the monorail, slides, and various shops. This set isn’t overly sturdy; if you want to move it after construction, I recommend having an adult do it. The monorail track fell off when I tried to move mine. Easy enough to fix, but it might be disappointing for kids to see. Perhaps my expectations (and preferences) are high, considering I normally construct Star Wars, Harry Potter, Ideas, and Architecture sets. I didn’t find Heartlake City Resort a particularly enjoyable build. It’s easy and repetitive. If I were to buy a set for a gift, I’d want it to demonstrate different building techniques or at least be fun to construct. I also didn’t like the large number of stickers. In some sets, you can skip applying the stickers and not lose appeal, but I think they’re necessary here, especially to add some pizzazz to all the white.

Holey moley this is a big one. There’s 1017 pieces, 26 stickers, 7 big numbered bags of pieces, 4 friends, 2 slides, and a dolphin… and a monorail, among a bunch of other little accessories (tacos and pizzas and a parasail!). It took a few hours to assemble. There are separate buildings but they all connect together, and the monorail tracks also connect to whichever two buildings you put on the ends. The friends are not your standard LEGO brick people minifigs - they’re “mini dolls”. Their feet still connect to a standard LEGO ground but otherwise they dolls are shaped really differently. You end up with a dollhouse-style resort with dolls, all of which happen to be plastic bricks (or brick-like) and connect together. The resort is really big! I’m really impressed with what you get in this set.
reviews.review_header: Whoa, this is an impressively big set!

reviews.review_text: We gave this set to our daughter for her 10th birthday and she says it gets 5 stars. This is by far the largest set that she has built with 7 labeled bags of pieces and a thick instruction book. She went right to work and had so much fun putting everything together. I love that different units came in different bags so we could get her to take a break when a section was completed. She built the entire thing herself with help only a couple of times to help her find small pieces that got dropped into the carpet in her room. Now that it is complete, she and her sister have fun with all the characters. Legos are fantastic for combining building skills, direction following, fine motor skills (some of the pieces are tiny!), and imaginative play.

My eight-year-old daughter is a big fan of LEGO Friends, so this set was a no-brainer. She also enjoys vacations. Put the two together and you get this set. There's a monorail, emphasis on the word "mono" as the rail only fits one LEGO friend and it goes around in circles. A little more exciting are the water slides with a "splash bucket" full of clear blue LEGO pieces. The set includes four figures, including a rare boy. The figures can be mixed and matched, although their skin color and gender limits this somewhat. Even more exciting than a male figure is the inclusion of a dolphin! Technically, this is a hotel, but there's only two places to sleep, which brings up some interesting questions as to who stays where. There's a telephone (really?), computer, juice bar, and the all-important roof terrace with DJ decks. There's also changing rooms and a restaurant, but the action is really out on the water: a water scooter with detachable parasailer, windsurf boar, and lifeguard stand. There's plenty of tiny pieces to play with (and lose) too. Everything you would expect for a resort is here, including bowls, cups, hot dogs, fruit, ice cream, keys, luggage and even a walkie-talkie. This set is more focused on experiences than reproducing a structure, and given that the water is mostly implied (with the exception of that splash bucket), it really opens up the set. If your child likes LEGO and vacations (who doesn't), this set is worth the investment.
reviews.review_header: Do you like vacations and friends?

name: LEGO 6212644 Harry Potter Hogwarts Great Hall 75954 Building Kit and Magic Castle Toy (878 Piece)

reviews.review_text: It is not exactly the entire Hogwarts castle; however, it is a must for Harry Potter LEGO fan like me to have this set. It is very beautiful architecture like a cathedral. The mini figures are a must also like Professor McGonagall, Quirrel, Hagrid, Nearly headless Nick, Susan Bones etc. I also like the Phoenix. The basilisk, although short, but it’s good enough. I like scabbers and Hedwig, but I don’t see Crookshanks so I got a Hermione w/ Crookshanks mini figure. The price is a bit high. Overall, I love it and I am thinking of getting the train set next time.
reviews.review_header: Hogwarts Great Hall - Great set indeed

reviews.review_text: This set was fun to build, and pretty straight-forward too. The pictures-only manual only led me astray once (the strangely fiddly hinges for the top of the tower, that didn't seem to line up at first...), and it's strangely addictive, as some parts were mystifying while being put together, and only made sense once you actually put them into the rest of the model. I did have a couple of minor niggles: I was missing a piece! A single, one-piece block, that appeared in the instructions, but was absent from the set. It was for the base of one of the buttresses on the outside of the hall, and while I ended up with a couple of pieces among the extras I could have used, I didn't know at the time if they were needed for something else! There was another case of one of the pieces being a different color than the manual indicated, but that was it, apart from that, it all went together pretty nicely. The finished model is wonderful, even if not all the bits seem built entirely to the same scale. The inclusion of 10 mini-figures means you can recreate most scenes from the films, even if getting Quirrel, but not Snape seems a bit odd. It's a little disappointing that there's only room for two of the four house banners to be hung up (though both are double-sided, so you can pick which ones you want to display), and it's not easy to reach inside the Hall once it's put together to get figures into it, but littler builders with smaller hands will have no problems. Overall, a fun set to build, and display. My only real complaint was that I wish it was bigger, and more complete version of the Hogwarts Castle, but I'm not a Lego fanatic, so I could have missed that, or maybe it's coming in the future?
reviews.review_header: Fun to build, and nicely detailed!

reviews.review_text: Nothing wrong with Legos, but the box was beat up because of insufficient packaging. This is disappointing if you receive an item that you want to gift and it looks as if it's been through a hurricane or worse

Our 4 year old son loves legos but he is drawn to the older in age sets such as this one. I end up building these sets and this was the largest I've assembled to date. I appreciate how each step was broken down into bite size steps and it didn't feel overwhelming. The next biggest I've done, Lego Batman Batmobile, was a real chore and maybe 100-200 less pieces. The instructions were almost flawless and we put in around 4 hours plus breaks and lunch from start till finish. Super cool and super fun as well! Excellent value with everything you recieve as well!
reviews.review_header: For once it was fun to assemble!

reviews.review_text: This was my first Lego set. I liked the subject, so that was fun. I had mixed impressions of the instructions. I liked the wordless, illustrated, step-by-step aspect, and they certainly got me there in the end. I think the instructions would be better if they somehow highlighted or pointed out the pieces featured in all the steps rather than some. Also, the order of the steps was a bit frustrating, jumping around to add a bit to each feature here and there. Overall, the set was fun, and I would definitely buy it again. While I might not assemble it again, I have young friends queued up for a turn.
My daughter asked me to buy this for her and she was super excited when it arrived. She put it together in one night by herself and the castle itself is beautiful to the eyes.

Incredible detail. My ten year old was in heaven building this. He is a huge potter head and this hit the nail on the head. Love the way you can see inside and view each individual room. Worked great adding onto the amping willow set as well. Nice work LEGO
Got this for 12-year old fan of lego and Harry Potter. He loves it.

name: LEGO Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets Hogwarts Whomping Willow 75953 Building Kit (753 Pieces)

reviews.review_text: Great add on for the amazing great hall set. Too bad on the minifigures although, Hermione is one of three in this wave and Sheamus is just a plain default face. Hoping for some more ravenclaws and hufflepuffs in the future.

We spent hours of fun to work together with our grandkids, 5 and 8 years old, of this Harry Potter set, we are planning to buy more Harry Potter LEGO sets. They are so nicely designed and including very easy to follow step by step instructions. After we finished we put them their bookshelf to display, they look very impressively beautiful! Highly recommend for Harry Potter LEGO fan and LEGO lovers!

My son just watch all the movies in the summer and he is now a fan of harry potter series. So when i bought this for his birthday, he build it in just one day. He is happy. Everything came great and in mint condition.
My 8 year old son built this in less than a day. He has it on display in his bedroom now. Cool set!
This set is so true to the movies, it doesn’t fit with just one of them either there are characters from the first 2 movies. Very cool!
Ordered as a birthday gift for 8 yr old girl and she put it together in no time. She was so excited and had requested this lego item. I would buy it again if any one of the kids asked for it.
Beautiful set and adds perfectly with the big castle. My ten year old loved building this. Quality work and detail for the potter heads out there.
My granddaughter was thrilled with this Lego set. She put it together along with the larger Hogwarts set and spent hours in happy play.
reviews.review_header: Great Lego set for Potter fans

name: LEGO Technic Bugatti Chiron 42083 Race Car Building Kit and Engineering Toy, Adult Collectible Sports Car with Scale Model Engine (3599 Piece)

reviews.review_text: Shout out to Lego for this stunningly-designed and manufactured Bugatti Chiron building kit. This incredible set with whopping 3,599 pieces is so sophisticated to a point where during four days of assembly, I was even able to learn the automobile production process and how each part works together to make a car fully functional. It is quite impressive to see that the complex mechanism can be recreated by building blocks. This beast is far beyond a level of toys and is really a good example of interdisciplinary efforts. The team at Lego has pushed their territory to another level unheard of, and their creativity and professionalism truly inspires and motivates me to do better for what I am doing.
reviews.review_header: I am so impressed by this amazing building set!

reviews.review_text: My son just turned 15 and he grew up building Legos, he is studying Engineering, when he got this Bugatti he got very excited it was a challenge a new record of 3,599 pieces for him to put together, when he open the box I can never forget his expression, he went through the boxes and the books, very detailed instructions (as every LEGO books), he couldn’t believe it, he said it was (by far) the best LEGO he was going to build, 7 days later with few hours here and there, he finished his master peace. Seeing him open every box and every bag turning the pages of the book to continue to build and his commitment to finish PRICELESS!!!!!!!!!, he says he might go for MECHANIC ENGINEERING.

I'm a big Lego fan, and am no stranger to some of their more complex (ahem, expensive...) sets. I've built the Disney Castle, the Lego Sandcrawler, numerous technic and Star Wars models, etc. This set takes the cake- it's by far the most interesting but also challenging building experience in all of my years. The attention to detail is insane- it has an actual, functioning transmission, independent suspension, working all-wheel drive, a working W-16 engine where you can see each piston fire in the correct sequence when moving, etc. Some people may think that it's not realistic enough, or doesn't look like the real car enough- that's not the point. The point is that it's an amazing feat of Lego design, and is quite impressive when complete (it's big, too). I take my time when building, so I can't remember how many hours it took, but it was quite a few!
reviews.review_header: The most impressive Lego set I've ever built

reviews.review_text: Just when I thought the guys at LEGO technic couldn’t out do themselves after the Porsche GTR, they go and hit a grandslam with this design. The attention to detail is mind boggling. The assembly process is simple, from a direction and assembly instructions, yet complex (You can easily miss a minute detail within a step, that can affect your overall build down the line). I can’t wait to see what they come up with next. Well done LEGO.
This was a fun model to build (challenging too). It is heavy when completed. There was much attention to detail put into this kit.

This LEGO kit is amazing. The mechanics in it is what impressed me most. You’ll enjoy every moment when putting it together. In my set one important piece was missing, however LEGO sent it to me promptly. I’m totally satisfied with my purchase.
Perfect details, still building it. Instructions are really clear, but it is a medium to high difficulty set

This is prob the best kit LEGO has made to date from the technic line. It’s also the most challenging build to date. With almost 900 pieces more then porsche 911 GT3 RS, this build will keep you engaged & entertained! Def worth the hefty retail price!
reviews.review_header: LEGO Technic Bugatti - Best LEGO set to date!

reviews.review_text: The invoices are extremely confusing and when we go to pay it is for items we purchased a few months prior which normally isn't bad, but can be when we get to the end of the fiscal year. Also the first page tends to list more items then what the total payment due box says which is confusing. Only list on that page what has to be paid for. Lastly, for our account purposes we need the itemized invoice for what is being paid for in the current invoice. Currently I have to find the previous months invoice to get the itemized list so I can pay the current month's invoice. So in other words, the amount that is due should also have the itemized invoice in the following pages in addition to the other active charges. I can't pay for an item if I can't code it in our budget and I shouldn't have to flip between different invoices from different months to figure it out. Keep it simple. These are the only invoices I have ever seen created in such a convoluted way. Every other invoice I handle is clear about what is being paid for accept this one.
reviews.review_header: ... we purchased a few months prior which normally isn't bad, but can be when we get to the ...

reviews.review_text: While the credit line is a convenience, the invoicing as it is handled by the third-party servicing provider is cumbersome to use. Product descriptions are truncated on the purchase detail provided. This makes it necessary for me to frequently take the extra step to research our purchases on our account in order to be able to code them. There is no total provided on the statement, again adding an extra step so I can be sure I am paying the correct amount. Since I opened the revolving credit line knowing it needed to be paid in full each month, I don't understand the point of checking off the boxes next to each purchase in order to be sure they are credited to the account. I feel with the sophisticated and impressive technology typically employed by Amazon, this style of invoicing is....inconsistent.
reviews.review_header: While the credit line is a convenience, the invoicing ...

reviews.review_text: Even though both my SS and DOB are correctly entered I kept getting the same below as encountered by other reviewers. Error message: "Your response to following fields is invalid Date of Birth can not be less than 8 characters. Social Security Number can not be less than 9 characters."
reviews.review_header: Don't waste your time filling out the form!

reviews.review_text: An absolute must for businesses, churches, etc. I pastor a small church which has a relatively low maximum on our business credit card. Amazon's corporate credit line gave me a very generous maximum credit line, allowed us to be sales tax exempt because we are a non-profit, and it is so simple to make a purchase. We can either use a P.O. Number or just our line of credit. A nicely detailed statement comes in the mail and I verify and approve it and turn it over to our treasurer/accountant for payment. I love it! Easiest way to purchase what we need, receive it with Amazon's always speedy shipment, and settle up when the statement comes in. If you have a church or business and don't have this you are missing out.
reviews.review_header: A nicely detailed statement comes in the mail and I verify ...

reviews.review_text: It's the easiest way to to have a business account associated with your personal account. This way you can pick and choose which account you want your purchase charged to. Only annoying thing is that the "Corporate" option will not show up as a payment option unless you choose the business address for delivery. I understand that's a security feature to protect against fraud but in our situation it's unnecessary and an annoyance. Other than that, no complaints.

The site does not work I too am having problems all fields are correct. It comes back and says that SS need to be 9 numbers. Then it says that the Birthdate has to be at least 8 numbers. It does not show any errors but never able to complete the application online.

I like the convenience of ordering things and paying in full. I do not like the way it is set up however. There is an order number when you order but on the credit card statement there is an invoice number and nothing to tie the two together except the amount and listed items. This makes it hard to reconcile the orders with the bill. It takes too much time to figure out. The billing seems to be lag behind quite a bit. We only pay bills once a month so it makes it difficult to make sure all invoices are paid. The statement doesn't reach us until after the deadline for our monthly bills.
reviews.review_header: love the convenience, BUT not the billing cycle

reviews.review_text: Wish there was a mechanism to have items categorized, such as book, video, video game, office supply, etc. Even if I could input that information when I ordered, it would help with my budget. As it is, I need to go through every invoice (lots) and try to determine which it is and then, if I can't remember, I need to look it up. It is essential to have this broken down for line items within our budget.

name: LEGO 6213564 Star Wars Advent Christmas Countdown Calendar 75213 New 2018 Edition, Minifigures, Small Building Toys (307 Pieces), Multicolor

reviews.review_text: I purchase this every year for my nephew & Oct. / Nov. kids gifts as it’s something fun for them to look forward to. They get so many toys that the parents appreciate a gift to open later. I have also used them as rewards for the kids as an incentive (good behavior/bringing home a complete work packet from school) even though they are Christmas themed the doors are numbered so you can use it anytime. Each day is individually wrapped so each build stays together until you are ready to build. Sometimes the pieces build on each other but they are all independent builds as well. Most of them are extremely simple and don’t take long to build but the anticipation each day is the real beauty of this calendar. I do feel like this set is more for boys. The Lego friends set is great for girls. It has more of the food and little animal figures which my daughter loved. Although the calendars are a little pricey, I feel like it is overall a good deal since the kids seem to enjoy each piece more than buying a larger set.
reviews.review_header: Great for a reward calendar anytime of year!

reviews.review_text: Absolutely love this! This is my first year buying a Lego Advent Calendar for my son. We've been doing Lego's for quite some time now so I thought this would be prefect for our Advent calendar this year. Especially since my son loves all the Lego 'city' sets. I'm very happy with the sets inside, how big it is & how beautiful the outside packaging looks. It's gonna be hard keeping him out of it but he'll be very excited once December 1st comes. My husband & I will definitely be buying this again.

What a disappointment. There is no Santa this year. I have purchased a Lego Advent calendar every year since they debuted, and it's been the Star Wars version ever since it came out. Only 1 other time do I recall there not being a Santa. I Back then I called and complained to Lego and the rep said that they were receiving a lot of complaints. I called again this year and the rep sent me a "Santa" to placate me. Well, it's a Santa body and hat but Geldolf hair. The Santa hat won't fit on the head. I'll be especially careful next year.

This review is for the Friends calendar specifically. I wish the reviews weren't aggregated for all three sets. I get this advent calendar for my daughter every year. This is the first year I can recall (and I may be wrong) where it doesn't come with a minifig/Friend. Sure she has tons of minifigs that she can use with these things, but opening the minifig on day 1 and then using it with the rest of the set is one of her favorite parts. I suspect she's going to be a little disappointed. I am disappointed with LEGO's decision to not include a figurine in this set.
reviews.review_header: Friends set doesn't come with a minifig

reviews.review_text: Bought this for my 8 year old. He loves his legos and I purchased him the Lego Movie Creator kit for Christmas this year so I thought this would be great for Christmas scenes and additional characters. We're only on day 3 but so far we are happy with it. Each "door" has a plastic bag with the pieces inside and instructions are shown on the inside of that door. He's built a rocketship, a man, and a car so far and he's anxious for the next day as soon as he's finished. I've read a lot of reviews by people who are serious lego collectors who were not happy with this set. These are people that know all of the different characters, pieces, etc. I am not that person. My kids love building and playing with them so my knowledge is limited to how much they enjoy them. I can tell you that this is a hit with them. I should also add that the character I showed in the pics has two faces, so they can choose which one shows......."happy go lucky face" or "oh boy" face. My kids thought that was a cool feature.

We do Lego Advent calendars every year (for as long as I can remember). In keeping with the tradition, I gave our youngest her Advent Calendar this evening (Friends version) - boy was this a disappointment (for me more than her I think). The box was manufactured upside down, meaning when you open the "flap" on the front (ie: the play area), the entire calendar is upside down. It kind of defeats the purpose of having something you look at and look forward to opening daily. You know what I mean: You look forward to getting "people" and "winter/seasonal" things to play with each day. I've updated my initial review as I've communicated with Lego support. Apparently this is the "new approach" by Lego. Meaning take everything that you were used to in years past and just change it with the Friends set. I don't know if "Friends" cost more to make than bricks, but you won't find any "Friends" in this set. The idea of "play" also seems to be lost on this set as you are really just making ornaments. I order these in September so that I have them for the kids. I would have returned it, but of course I'm way outside of the return window. If you like the Friends sets from years past, you might be disappointed. Of course, if you want to make ornaments for the tree - you might love it! This really should just be called the Lego Ornament Set. You may have fun putting them together, but it is not at all like the sets of years past. I could live with that, except that it is marketed besides the other Advent Calendars and appears to be the only one to receive this new approach. Sorry - don't mean to be a HumBug - just not what we were expecting and clearly Lego had absolutely no intent of losing potential buyers by marketing the product for what it really is - "NOT Lego Friends".

Super disappointed with this set. It’s my fault for not looking more closely at what was included, but unlike previous years this set does not include any of the friends and you don’t put together things to make a bigger scene. Each one is a Christmas tree decoration. It has nothing at all to do with LEGO Friends, except the picture on the box. I had looked carefully at many sets, but this one went on sale and I thought I had already looked at it. My mistake. But I definitely don’t recommend it, if you are looking for something related to LEGO Friends. Side note, I really wish amazon wouldn’t lump all the reviews together.

name: LEGO Star Wars Darth Vader’s Castle 75251 Building Kit (1060 Pieces) - (Amazon Exclusive)

reviews.review_text: It's the Christmas season, for goodness sake! Why would you ship a LEGO set without any outer covering or box and leave it on the porch. It was the first thing my grandson saw when he got home from school today, spoiling a Christmas surprise.

This comes in the retail packaging, it is not frustration free as described (must be an error). Awesome gift for a collector, LEGO enthusiast or Star Wars Fan. Its a big kit, just like one Santa may put under the tree. At over a thousand pieces with five Mini Figs including Bacta Tank (Darth Vader) this is a rarity and an exclusive kit. Both the Tie Advanced Fighter and Darth Vader's Castle are well designed allowing it for rougher play unlike some sets we have gotten in the past. Min Figs Included: Includes five minifigures 1 Darth Vader 1 Bacta Tank Darth Vader 2 Royal Guards 1 Imperial Transport Pilot.

This is an awesome set for a younger LEGO-er. It is doable by a 9 year old, although if they're new to LEGO they may need some supervision and help. But the instructions are as clear as ever, the pieces are organized and can be found relatively quickly, and the whole set builds up into a very satisfying tower/playhouse. Build times will vary, but it took my 9 year old about a week of work, on and off. Once built, this set (unlike some others) offers a ton of play value to a young Star Wars fan, and it goes from being a STEM toy to being an imagination/creativity toy, as they use the minifigs, fighter plane, and tower to create imaginative stories. There are not a ton of moving parts (which any kid will tell you are the fun parts) but there are enough, and there are even working "weapons" on the fighter and the gunner on the turret. If I had any complaint it's that it's fairly monochromatic (so much gray and black), but my kid doesn't mind and that makes it more realistic. For the number of pieces included, I think this is a great deal and it's definitely a cool set for a 9-12 year old.
reviews.review_header: Very satisfying set for younger builder with great play value, too

reviews.review_text: Anakin Skywalker, I found a loop of bacta required for the fixation of several components of the sort that would need it for trouble once made a mistake, but you can piece it. Just a warning to avoid from about a three hour diversion from being able to put this together. Netflix was on in the background, The Office, the episode where Michael eats a ton of pasta and then tries to run 5k for benefit of Merideth who had feline rabies. The part when he brakes, screen froze for a second and I had tie fighter parts everywhere. So it’s a good set. You would take from it the black pieces and might be some red - I would prepare for this in six ways: A) it’s ok. B) just slow down for a minute. 3) you can do this! 4) it will go together but less is less is sometimes more. 5) or less!! F) mission accomplished but not like when George said it when it wasn’t. My advice? Do it! Add to cart. Queue up Netflix. Ha ha, Stanley, ha ha!!

LEGO has done it again. What a great set for Star Wars fan and/or collector. It is a big kit with 1060 pieces, 5 mini figures and includes not only Darth Vader’s castle and a Tie Advanced Fighter. The five mini figures are Darth Vader, Bacta Tank Darth Vader, two Royal Guards and an Imperial Transport Pilot. It will be fun to build and play with, but the collector in the family wants to keep it boxed!

I got this for my son in law, who is close to 30. He loves Star Wars, collectibles, and of course Legos! He probably had more fun putting this over 1000 piece Darth Vader Castle together than most kids! The figures make it all the more fun. Good instructions and everything fit like a charm!
reviews.review_header: Great fun for any Star Wars fans!

reviews.review_text: A great build with over 1000 pieces. Definitely challenging but not overly so, even for kids. Any Star Wars LEGO fan will be thrilled with this, the mini figures are great as is Vader’s tie fighter.
reviews.review_header: A must for any Star Wars LEGO fan

reviews.review_text: Same problem here! I signed up for the discreet packaging options and it came In giant LEGO printed packaging. That’s hard to hide if your trying to surprise your child.
